content:
Quote from https://docs.backdropcms.org/api/backdrop/core%21modules%21layout%21layout.api.php/function/hook_block_info/1:

An associative array whose keys define the delta for each block and whose: values contain the block descriptions.

Is it a mistake or it's my imperfect knowledge of English? I wouldn't divide the sentence like that.
The colon should be removed, and then, I guess, the rest of the sentence bolded.

@Alan Mels Its because the @return statement doesn't have a data type after it. See this issue for details: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3954

Add missing data type indicators to @return tags throughout core 路 Issue #3954 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
According to the documentation standards: The @return tag is followed by a data type indicator, and then a newline. The following paragraph is considered by the API module to be documentation. and:...

The bold part should be the return keyword and then the following datatype. Then a colon is added, and the rest of the text follows. However if there is no datatype, then the whole first line is bolded and the colon added after that.
Since the documentation standards mandate a datatype, then the fix is to add data types where they're missing, as per the issue I linked to.
So no need to report this particular case if the issue is known?
No need, but you're welcome to help fix it via that issue if you like :wink:

BWPanda said:

No need, but you're welcome to help fix it via that issue if you like :wink:

Oh, so many other more important things to do, I just pass this time to the issue you referenced.
I understand. That's why I haven't gotten back to it either.
